description:
Outstanding Renovation In Central Location
Here it is, the renovated beauty with the most convenient locale. From the contemporary entrance onward guests will be impressed as the attractive home has been refurbished with a modern, yet neutral-toned colour scheme.
Your family will have year-round comfort via the zoned refrigerated heating-cooling unit. This abode boasts three generous bedrooms and the sense of space continues with the dining area open plan to both the lounge and extremely functional kitchen with its stainless steel appliances, great bench space, breakfast bar and large pantry.
Picturesque views are on hand overlooking the vast front yard and the oak tree lined street. The window shutters throughout bring privacy and add a touch of style. The allotment is just over the quarter acre with 1105m2 of land and the property offers dual access granting convenience, privacy and security. Pretty and central, it would be considered a perfect weekender or maybe a B&B. Creswick's fabulous coffee and cafes are almost at your front door, while Ballarat is just ten minutes away, Daylesford a little more and Melbourne just over an hour away.
Those seeking a development opportunity will be pleased to know, the permit for a subdivision of 310m2 has been granted by council at the rear of the property.
Internal area
310m²

Amazing Rural Block with a Million Dollar View.
Situated in the picturesque township of Mount Glasgow and just 10 minutes from Clunes and 35 Minutes to Ballarat & Daylesford is this 17.8 acre property with commanding panoramic views. The hard work has been done with the level home site cleared and Power connected to the box. The original home was demolished with planning permits lodged for a new home which have unfortunately lapsed. Currently used as a weekend getaway for its Melbourne owners, with a heavy heart they are passing on this opportunity to build a stunning home in this unique environment to another lucky person.
The current home site sits near the middle of the block with a gated driveway already in place, watertanks, shedding and a caravan with a dam nearby and a rambling pathway leading you up the side of Mount Glasgow. Surrounded by farmland and State Reserve, the views are truly something to behold.
Here is your chance to purchase a significant land holding for the price of a small residential block.
Please Contact our agent to organise your own private inspection.
17.8 acres(approx.) of elevated land
Uninterrupted 270 degree views
Level Building site with Electricity connected
Zoned Rural Living

address: Option 2-1073 Coghills Creek Rd Coghills Creek VIC 3364
description:
Rare Find-30.58 ha (76.55 acres)- Plus 45 Megs of Bore Water !
This fertile country awaits the true Farmer seeking production with the security of WATER. Located on the North Eastern Slopes of Mt Bolton this land has previously been used for Potatoes, Fat Lambs, Cattle and Hay production.Zoned "Farming"-the land (no dwelling permitted) is purely for agricultural purposes. Animals will thrive on the warm rich pastures, whilst the growing of Vegetables or Grapes, Aquaculture, or Aquaponics and Livestock are all viable options as the 45 Megalitres of Bore water guarantees a return for effort. In the recent seasons WATER has been the key to Farm security because it allows constant production and debt re-payment. Located just off the sealed Coghill's Creek road, approximately 15 Minutes North of Ballarat this property can be run from your Ballarat base with ease.
Note. The adjoining Home Portion of 2 Ha (5 acres) is available if you are seeking a complete farm package.

address: Part 14 Of 510 Avoca Road Talbot VIC 3371
description:
COUNTRY BASE CAMP AWAITS
A beautiful 10 Acres of Farmland in the heart of the Goldfields close to the township of Talbot. Offering a seasonal creek at rear, some fencing front and sides for definition of your block. Ready for you to use as a camping block or perhaps in the future as a home site. Enjoy coming up to the area, have as a base camp when you are prospecting and perhaps keep things in a container but get a permit to do so.

address: 1105 Clunes-Mount Cameron Road Mount Cameron VIC 3370
description:
'Cobar Park' - Versatile Rural Holding - 258 Megalitre Irrigation Licences
1612 Acres (652 Hectares)
Lot 1 - 503 acres, Lot 2 - 559 acres, Lot 3 - 550 acres
(Offered as a whole or in 3 separate lots)
- 2 x modest 3 bedroom settlement homes
- 2 stand shearing shed with undercover bugle sheep yards, separate cattle yards
- Excellent water supply from bores & dams
- Superb balance of rich volcanic and clay loam soils
- Subdivided into approximately 30 main paddocks. Central laneway system
- Enhanced biosecurity - government road surrounding approximately 90% of the property
- Outstanding location - central to Ballarat and Bendigo, under 2 hours to Melbourne CBD and International Airport
Expression of Interest
Closing: Thursday 5th September at 4.00pm
Rob Rickard - 0407 354 025
Martin Skahill - 0427 431 744

For Tender
48.8 HA (approx. 120.5 acres)
Prime red soil suitable for potatoes, fat lambs and cropping
Elevated, well-drained location with excellent views
25 meg. Water Licence and domestic bore
7 Titles, 3 road frontages and existing old house
Tender: Closes 13th Sept 2019 @ 4pm.
For further details and on-site inspection contact the managing agent @ Elders Ballarat
Bram Gunn 0400 683222 (all hours)

The Choice Is Yours, Two Brand New Creswick Homes
Unrivalled in quality, unparalleled in design and exclusively yours; whether you choose the one to the left or the one to the right you will be totally mesmerised by the modern-day choice and the essence of these self titled homes.
Both homes have three bedrooms and two bathrooms and are brand spanking new. Built by a well-known and regarded builder, these homes are absolutely quality, with no shortcuts applied. Both have central gas heating (natural) and reverse cycle split system, a double garage with direct entry to home and powered doors, the landscape is complete and they are completely turn key for your immediate occupancy.
Sitting on approx. 314m2 provides low maintenance living, with the opportunity here to live freely in one and rent out the other,(rent appraised at approx. $370per week) or consider your elderly parents occupying one to provide independent living just an arms length away.
The designs are reversed yet offer completely different facades, while the sleek open plan incorporates three cosy carpeted bedrooms with built in robes, a stylish ensuite & family bathrooms, a lovely light meals/family room connected seamlessly with tasteful timber look floors to a modern kitchen with subway splash backs and stainless steel appliances.
A slightly raised deck and a fully contained yard for private gardening just caps off these sensational homes, while the location is paramount with 20 minutes drive to Ballarat, 20 minutes to Daylesford and easy access to Melbourne for daily commuters. Davis St is a no through road, just off Melbourne Road, which places you in a prominent location on the skirts of Creswick.
For further information, contact our agent today, as you can make your choice after inspecting them both.

Stunning Contemporary Light Filled Home with Beautiful Views
Upon driving into the entrance of the peaceful area of the RACV Goldfields Resort you are met with the well-manicured and popular golf course leading the way to this modern and relaxed light filled home.
You are surrounded by wildlife and an abundance of birdlife, the opportunity to enjoy outdoor recreation on your doorstep including, cycle, running and walking tracks, playing tennis and golf plus the amenities offered by the hotel on site. This is the perfect backdrop of this split-level home where the floor to ceiling windows take in the picturesque views of the 1st Tee, and practice green.
You are greeted by hardwood timber flooring in the bright and light filled front foyer. On the first floor you have your master bedroom of an envious size and position with a balcony to sit out on, from this room take in the amazing views over the golf greens, you have an ensuite complete with double vanity and double shower, and toilet, there is a walk in robe with a sky light allowing natural light to come through. The other two bedrooms are large in size and have built in robes with a fit out of shelves and drawers. Plenty of storage with a double linen press. The main bathroom is also on this level.
On the ground floor is the remarkable open plan living, dining and kitchen, with large floor to ceiling windows flooding this area with light. The lounge area is spacious with an effective gas log fire and doors out to a lounge area. The beautiful modern kitchen has a walk in pantry, dishwasher, 900mm electric oven, 5 burner gas top, stone worktops and lots of drawers and cupboard space, and the large island bench doubles as a breakfast bar that flows on to the dining area. The laundry has eye and floor level cupboards. There is a study with a built in desk and shelving or can be utilised as a store room. Also, a valuable powder room on this level.
You have wonderful wrap around decking ideal to sit out to relax or to entertain friends and family while taking in the serenity.
The double-driveway leading to an oversized double lock up garage has been fitted with handy shelving and has direct access to the home.
The current owners have upgraded much of the home over the years, features include quality fixtures and fittings, great flow of the homes floorplan, double glazed tinted reflective windows, zoned central heating and refrigerated cooling, outdoor and indoor blinds.
The town of Creswick is a growing town rich with a friendly atmosphere, café culture, farmers market, local produce shops, just a short drive to Daylesford or to Ballarat and close to the freeway for a commute to Melbourne.
You wont be disappointed with this home call to book your inspection today.

Homestead heaven - Lifestyle, location and acreage!
This lovely Homestead sitting in the heart of the land is 15 minutes to Daylesford, 10 minutes to a freeway access to Melbourne, 10 minutes to Creswick and 20 minutes to Ballarat. Set in an established garden with surround verandahs the homestead offers lovely period features with lead light front door, ceiling cornices and roses, picture rails and much more. Enter the front door into a wide hallway and you will find 3 good sized bedrooms all with fireplaces and a separate living room with wood fire heater and French doors to the verandah. The formal dining room has a fireplace and direct access to the kitchen and a central bathroom with marble style tiling and claw foot bath adds to the period charm of this homestead. The home opens out into a country style kitchen, meals and casual living area with French doors to the verandah. Just adjacent to the homestead you will find a separate bathroom, laundry and storage area as well as a converted shearing shed guest retreat that is set to impress.
On the working side, currently a sheep stud, there is a large machinery shed with inspection pit capable of housing 10 plus cars, 2 car Garage, a large workshop shed, a 3 sided shed for hay or other, secure dog run, chook shed and run, functioning shearing shed, holding yard, fully fenced perimeter and fenced paddocks, central run for easy moving of stock between paddocks, town water, a bore, water tank, water troughs, 2 dams- one is an overflow dam and lovely volcanic soil. Large old Cypress trees stem the home paddocks and from the front there is a view to Forest Hill. This property really offers everything- lifestyle opportunity, location and acreage- weekender, live in, work the land, you choose.
Features:
Homestead property with period features- ceiling cornices, roses, picture rails, lead light front door
Surround verandah
Established garden
Wide Hallway entrance
3 good size bedrooms, master with BIR, all with fireplaces
Separate Living with wood fire heater, French doors, currently has an area as the home office as well
Separate dining with fireplace and access to kitchen
Country style kitchen
Open plan casual living and meals
Central bathroom with claw foot bath
Central ducted gas heating
Adjacent to homestead second bathroom, separate storage and separate laundry
Converted Shearers Shed guest retreat
Functional shearing shed, holding yard
Large machinery shed with inspection pit, capable of garaging 10 plus cars
2 car Garage
Large workshop shed
3 sided shed
Secure Dog run
Chook shed and run
Town water
Registered Bore
Water troughs to all paddocks bar one
2 dams, one overflow dam
Fully fenced perimeter
Fenced paddocks with central run for easy movement of stock
Workable land
View to Forest Hill
Large Cypress trees to the home paddock
15 minutes to Daylesford, 10 minutes to freeway access to Melbourne , 10 minutes to Creswick and 20 minutes to Ballarat

MAGNIFICENT BALLARAT DAYLESFORD DISTRICT
87.9 Acres WONGA 35.57 Hectares
Only 25 minutes to Ballarat and 20 Minutes to Daylesford, superbly situated fronting Kingstons delightful Avenue of honor - in the heart of the Central Highlands.
Wonga comprises elevated rich versatile red volcanic soils with stunning views and rural aspects of the surrounding district and countryside; with a tremendous home site
(Subject to Council approval).
Featuring new steel cattle yards, good fencing (6 paddocks), a registered irrigation dam (17 megalitres), 3 megalitre stock and domestic water right and town water running past the property.
Ideal lifestyle, alternate farming, prime lamb and cattle breeding, cropping
and / or vegetable production holding.
Comprising two tiles (to be sold as a whole)
Wonga provides a rare opportunity to secure blue ribbon land in the heart of a most sought after appealing district.
Inspection highly recommended and by appointment

6.8 acres ideal for weekend camping
Set in a lovely location with views to Mt Grenoch, this 6.8 acre block backs onto bushland full of Australian wildlife. Zoned farming and includes some shedding. Less than 10 mins to Clunes, 15 minutes to Maryborough and 40 minutes to Ballarat.

Lot 3, 30 acres approx. of Rural Living (STCA)
Lot 3, access via Bucklands/Hull Lane located at the rear of Lot 1, 4875 Ballarat-Maryborough Rd, Dunach. This gently sloping property is good grazing with a fantastic dam including flying fox and views in every direction. Plenty of space for bike riding or just getting back to nature.
10 minutes to Clunes, 15 minutes to Maryborough & 40 minutes to Ballarat.

address: Lots 9-16, Part Of 110 Mount Greenoch Road Talbot VIC 3371
description:
SWEEPING COUNTRY VIEWS THAT WILL AMAZE!
Zoned farming this superb piece of land with amazing views is ideal for a potential home site (STCA) or farming land on 52ha or 130 acres (approx.). Situated only minutes from the popular township of Talbot the land is in a lovely elevated position with views of Mount Greenoch and the distant Ranges. With front access from Mount Greenoch Rd and side access from Mitchell Rd this grazing land offers a large dam and several paddocks consisting of multiple titles. Access is by sealed road and the land is mostly fenced, recently surveyed and is currently running cattle. If you want space with peace and quiet or to add to your farming portfolio, this one truly is waiting for you!
Contact Alisa Johnson at our Maryborough office on 0409935766

Big Savings For First Home Owners!
This allotment will entice you to take the next step. Ready to go with all services available including natural gas, this 395m2 parcel of land has new colourbond fences on two sides, with more original fences making up the balance of this great building block. Just two minutes drive to the bustling town centre; this neat slice of land (surrounded by well established homes) has all the makings for good country living at a price that will allow you to escalate your building plans with ease.
Virtually positioned at the Newstead eturn offf in the thriving township of Creswick, this block provides a handy location to the local grocery store eFlemosf, it also provides walking distance to the Creswick North Primary School along with various speciality stores & local businesses.
Whether you are just starting out, investing your superannuation or thinking of retiring, this vacant block of land will provide an orderly low maintenance start to begin your dream home or investment.

52 Acre, Gorgeous Five Bedroom Home with Outbuildings and Views
Set in a lovely rural setting of approx 52 acres Aghadoe Estate is conveniently located between Daylesford and Ballarat and only 5 mins to Creswick. Built in circa 1860 but renovated extensively it still retains all of its period charm however has many modern comforts.
The homestead
The sweeping tree lined driveway leads you to the homestead with its wrap around Wisteria covered verandas and gardens. The homestead offers many period features including wide hallway with an arch and dado railing, high ceilings, cast iron fireplaces and timber flooring. Modern conveniences include a fabulous light filled gourmet kitchen with gorgeous original exposed brick feature wall and vaulted ceiling, four spacious bedrooms each with its own fireplace, two modern bathrooms, two inviting living areas each with wood burning fires (Jetmaster & Coonara), study, storage/utility room, ducted heating and cooling, slab heating to the kitchen, split system, monitored alarm system.
The Studio/5th Bedroom
A wonderful tranquil space which could be used as guest bedroom with its own ensuite complete with bespoke vanity and freestanding bath and a walk in robe. It also has a split system.
Outside the property offers many extensive lawn areas, a lovely fenced lawn courtyard with water fountain, ornamental grape vine covered arbour, an orchard of fruit and nut trees, chook pen and majestic wrought iron gates which lead to the expansive rear garden.
Other features include -
- Converted original stables with concrete floor and veranda to the back which could be used as a fantastic entertaining space
- Partially converted shearing shed ideal for guest accommodation/B & B (STCA), home office, artist studio has been fully lined and insulated, mezzanine, timber floors, plantation shutters, French doors leading to deck, picturesque views over the countryside
- Established gardens
- Vegetable garden completed with potting shed and greenhouse
- Majestic fir trees
- 6 paddocks with electric fencing and stock troughs, cattle yards with ramp
- Spring fed dam with irrigation to house garden
- 3 x 25,000 litre water tanks
- Town water
- 3 bay lock up garage
Aghadoe Estate is ideal for a weekend retreat, family home or a continuation of the currents owner's successful guest accommodation and wedding venue business.

2 Acres of Modern Lifestyle Living
This magnificent modern ranch style home is set on approximately 2 acres offering privacy and space just minutes to central Creswick and 10 minutes to Wendouree and Ballarat. Boasting four generous bedrooms, the master with a walk-in wardrobe and spacious ensuite. The open plan living is large, vibrant and flawless integration of indoor/outdoor living. The large undercover outdoor area (6x8) offers the perfect entertaining space and is fully fenced, perfect for the little ones to play without wandering too far. The home is well insulated internally and externally in the walls, a double layer in the ceiling along with double glazed windows, doors and a split cycle cooler insist that you will remain nice and comfortable during the heat of summer. A well-positioned wood fire would also ensure you remained nice and warm during the winter months. Adding to the wow factor is the modern commercial kitchen with corner pantry and stainless-steel benchtops and cupboards. A double lock up garage and (5x8) garden/wood shed complete this property. This quiet and tranquil home is well presented, with great rural scenery even the local wildlife can't resist a regular visit. If you are looking for that change in lifestyle, this home will impress.
* This information has been prepared to assist solely in the marketing of this property. While all care has been taken to ensure the information provided herein is correct, we do not take responsibility for any inaccuracies. Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

THREE BEDROOM MUD BRICK HOUSE CLOSE TO TALBOT- 12 ACRES (approx) - 2 DAMS
Located only 10 minutes from Talbot, approx 20 mins from Maryborough and 52 mins to Ballarat, this property offers a substantial home, to mains power, large tanks, good shed - constructed from mud bricks. With 3 double bedrooms, open-plan living area has been painted in a light-enhancing cream which combines beautifully with lofty timber beams and doors. There is a wood fire heater which warms the interior, a dining space adjacent to the bright updated tiled kitchen fitted with generous cupboards and a stainless steel oven. The living area has been carpeted. Three double bedrooms offer excellent accommodation and the tiled bathroom houses vanity, toilet, claw-foot bath with over-head shower (built in 'step-up' for comfort). Laundry fixtures are also plumbed into the bathroom. Outside there are broad verandas front (decked) and back; 13m x 3.5m caravan/carport; 9m x 7m garage with workshop; 3 tanks (approx 100,000 litres). There are 2 dams - the major one with good catchment providing water to the gardens plus gravity flow, solar hot water system. This property would be a delight for anyone with horses and the sheer enjoyment of a rural lifestyle. Paddy's Ranges (State Forest) is at the back door. Inspections invited.

Family Home on Huge Town Block
Positioned on a generous country block of 2387m2(approx.) with stunning views of Farmland and Mount Kooroocheang is this spacious family home ready for someone to add some flair and make their mark.
Situated in the historic town of Newlyn and just 10 a minute drive to Daylesford or Creswick and less than 90 minutes drive to the Melbourne CBD you have easy access to all the modern conveniences while enjoying a laid-back home life surrounded by nature. Yes, you CAN have your cake and eat it too this time!
Open plan living is the key with a full hostess kitchen leading to a large freshly painted living and dining area with hardwood floors. This is then complimented with a tiled formal lounge/family room with a huge back yard.
The freshly upgraded central bathroom with tiled floors has a new shower and vanity and plenty of space to add a stunning claw foot bath.
The master suite is to the rear of the home and is both spacious and light filled with w2w carpets along with walk in robes and a full ensuite with corner spa.
The remaining two bedrooms are carpeted with BIRs offering much more space than you would expect.
Outside there is a post and rail front fence and circular drive way, a double carport and garage that has partially been converted to a man cave with carpet.
Additionally, there is a second 2 room bungalow partially converted into separate accommodation towards the rear of the block.
With a very realistic reserve do not delay! Get in touch with our team today to book an inspection.
Large 2387m2 block (approx).
Master with W.I.R. and en-suite
Freshly updated family bathroom
10 Minutes to Daylesford & Creswick

'The Blue Cottage'. A Stunning Example of Period Charm.
Lovingly maintained and situated on the high side of the road is this Victorian era cottage, with stunning gardens and a plethora of original features including lead light windows and a mixture of timber and pressed metal ceilings.
Rich in historic old world charm and providing a satisfying sense of connection to Creswicks past, 'the blue cottage' boasts wonderful street appeal. From the charming picket fence, to the lovingly maintained English cottage gardens with steps that lead up to the front veranda, you will become lost in the history of this charming home.
On entering the home you are presented with a central hallway with original polished floorboards with bedrooms to each side, leading through to the central lounge room with a gas log fire and stunning period mantle, along with the modern convenience of a split system and period light fittings which feature through the whole home.
The country style kitchen has electric cooking, Solid pine cupboards and bench tops, deep vintage style sinks with the original Metters wood stove sitting proudly as a centerpiece along with the added benefit of a full walk in pantry. The kitchen seamlessly flows to the formal dining room, sharing timber tongue and groove walls and ceilings and polished boards.
The bedrooms are light filled and all feature tongue and groove timber ceilings and polished floor boards, the master bedroom with ample hand crafted B.I.R.s.
The bathroom is positioned toward the rear of the home with an ever inviting claw foot bath with brass fittings with an antique timber vanity and a feature lead light window.
Outside the rear door(again with lead light features), is a more recently constructed extra deep carport built to seamlessly blend with the home, which also serves as a fantastic sheltered entertaining area. Extensive cottage gardens flow through the back yard, leading to the 2 Bay rear shed with separate street access from Pasco St .
With triple street frontage this home is also an ideal subdivision opportunity with the ability to build 2 units on the rear of the block(STCA).
Add to this instant gas hot water, NBN connection, a short walk to the train station and only a 15 minute drive to Ballarat, and easy access to Melbourne, you will be hard pressed to find a better opportunity. Contact our office today to arrange your inspection

Picturesque Block Has You Building 30 Seconds From Town
This is a rare opportunity to secure a country aspect while only being 30 seconds back into the hub of town. The parcel is high set delivering wonderful views over countryside and bush land. Measuring 1050m2 and a frontage of over 20 meters the block will take a large floor plan of your dream home. The parcel is off the service lane granting more privacy than expected. There is an existing planning permit for a dwelling and there has been approval previously for additional shedding to be added to any construction. Owners can soon enjoy picturesque bushwalks, while your favourite coffee shop, restaurant, shopping and more are also within walking distance.

Accordingly, all interested parties should make their own inquiries to verify the information.

Perfectly Positioned, Cottage With Character
Full of charm and sitting slightly elevated to the street, this delightful lace trimmed miner's cottage with pretty cottage garden has been beautifully uplifted to meet today's needs and comforts.
Keeping the original structure and nestled amongst other super cute cottages, this home lies within a 100 metre walk to the main street, to two primary schools and is opposite Apex Park.
This time-honoured cottage would be ideal for first home buyers or retirees.
